content.prompt: In the opening sentences of the passage (“Now I know . . . color of my hair!”), the author refers to Alice Walker primarily to

choices.label: impress her audience with the breadth of her literary knowledge
flaunt her access to privileged information about the planning of the commencement ceremony
congratulate her audience for inviting her instead of a lesser-known speaker
acknowledge the potentially embarrassing circumstances under which she is delivering her speech

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify and describe components of the rhetorical situation - the exigence, audience, purpose, context, and message.
